English Definition: present in large quantities
Example Sentence: Because the island has abundant rain, it is covered in thick, green forests.

English Definition: the ability to go into (when somebody or something must allow you to enter); to go into something when allowed to enter
Example Sentence: Only students have access to the university library.

English Definition: to gradually collect; to gather together over time
Example Sentence: Dust tends to accumulate quickly under the bed if you don't clean regularly.

English Definition: correct (about information, not opinions); free from errors
Example Sentence: That test is not an accurate test of intelligence.

English Definition: used to something; familiar with something so that it seems normal
Example Sentence: After living in Alaska for a year, he became accustomed to the cold weather.

English Definition: to accomplish a goal
Example Sentence: The best students know that to achieve good grades, they have to study every day.

English Definition: to get (especially when you will continue to get more); to come into possession of
Example Sentence: Janice isn't a doctor yet, but from her studies she's slowly acquiring the knowledge and skills she'll need.

English Definition: refusing to change an opinion; unyielding
Example Sentence: Despite the evidence, the politician remained adamant that his policy was correct.

English Definition: good enough for what you need; enough to suit your needs
Example Sentence: A very light jacket will be adequate for Los Angeles's warm winter.

English Definition: close to or next to
Example Sentence: The fire station is adjacent to the school, ensuring a quick response in emergencies.

English Definition: to change or move a little and make better or more accurate; to change something so it serves its purpose better
Example Sentence: The colors on this TV screen are wrong. I'll adjust them.

English Definition: the running of something or an organization (business, school, government, etc); the person or people in charge
Example Sentence: The university administration cancelled all school events after a bad storm left most buildings without electricity.

English Definition: something that makes it easier to achieve success; a positive factor
Example Sentence: Being tall gives basketball players a significant advantage over shorter opponents.

English Definition: unfavorable; against one's desires
Example Sentence: The medication was effective, but it had some adverse side effects like headaches.

English Definition: to publicly support
Example Sentence: Environmental groups advocate for stricter laws to protect endangered species.

English Definition: to change, make different, have an effect
Example Sentence: Which language we speak affects how we think about the world.

English Definition: to combine; to gather into a mass or whole
Example Sentence: The website aggregates news stories from dozens of different sources into one page.

English Definition: assertive and pushy; ready to attack or confront
Example Sentence: The aggressive marketing campaign helped the company double its sales in one year.

English Definition: to put aside for a specific purpose; to distribute
Example Sentence: The government decided to allocate more funds to education this year.

English Definition: to change, to adjust
Example Sentence: Magazines heavily alter the photos of celebrities they publish.

English Definition: other possibility or option; different, other than the main option
Example Sentence: The menu includes alternatives for students who don't eat meat.

English Definition: someone who is inexperienced or not highly skilled in a particular area
Example Sentence: Although he is an amateur photographer, his pictures look very professional.

English Definition: having several potential meanings; unclear and difficult to understand
Example Sentence: The ending of the movie was ambiguous, leaving the audience to decide what really happened.

English Definition: having large goals; showing a strong desire and determination to succeed
Example Sentence: The ambitious engineer planned to build a bridge longer than any other in the world.

English Definition: to change for the better; to improve (usually a document or law)
Example Sentence: The constitution was amended to allow women the right to vote.

English Definition: plentiful; enough or more than enough
Example Sentence: There was ample space in the car for all of our luggage.

English Definition: to try to understand something better by closely looking at its details
Example Sentence: The accountant was too busy with paperwork to analyze the report that said the company had no money.

English Definition: yearly; happening every year
Example Sentence: Everyone in Manchester was excited about the annual game between the city's two soccer teams.

English Definition: deviation from the norm; something that deviates from what is standard
Example Sentence: Snow in the middle of summer is an anomaly that surprised the meteorologists.

English Definition: to tease or be hostile towards a person or group
Example Sentence: He didn't mean to antagonize his coworkers, but his criticism was taken personally.

English Definition: clearly seen or understood; seeming (but not definitely true)
Example Sentence: After only a few months, it was apparent that the French would not win the war.

English Definition: to come/go closer to something or someone; a way to do something
Example Sentence: The new CEO had a very strange approach to management, letting his employees sleep whenever they wanted.

English Definition: based on a whim or random desire rather than reason
Example Sentence: The decision to promote him seemed arbitrary, as he had less experience than the others.

English Definition: requiring a lot of effort; difficult and tiring
Example Sentence: Climbing Mount Everest is an arduous journey that tests both physical and mental strength.

English Definition: a range of subjects or studies, a field, a discipline
Example Sentence: Researchers working in many different areas, from psychology to physics, will be able to use the new type of plastic.

English Definition: a feature, a characteristic, a particular part of something
Example Sentence: The three most important aspects to think about when learning a language are grammar, vocabulary, and pronunciation.

English Definition: to look closely at and figure out the value or type of something
Example Sentence: Before buying a house, you should always assess the building carefully.

English Definition: to help or aid
Example Sentence: The box was too big to carry, so John asked the store manager to assist him.

English Definition: to lessen a negative feeling; to soothe
Example Sentence: To assuage her guilt, she apologized to everyone she had offended.

English Definition: to believe without proof; to suppose
Example Sentence: Ahmed assumed his forgetful professor wouldn't remember their meeting, but the professor was already waiting for him.

English Definition: a set way of thinking or a set feeling about something or someone
Example Sentence: Zach always has a positive attitude when he has to deal with a problem at work.

English Definition: to give an event or person credit for something; a quality or feature that is an important part of something
Example Sentence: The museum director attributed the recently discovered painting to Van Gogh.

English Definition: to increase or make larger; to add to
Example Sentence: He took a second job to augment his income and pay off his debts faster.

English Definition: control or responsibility over something (people, area, laws, etc)
Example Sentence: Only Congress has the authority to make and pass laws for the country.

English Definition: able to be reached, used, or bought
Example Sentence: The advisor was not available to meet all day Monday, so the student had to come back on Tuesday.

English Definition: to have knowledge of; being conscious of
Example Sentence: As Helen drove away from the gas station, she wasn't aware that her lights were off.

English Definition: something positive or advantageous; something good coming from an action
Example Sentence: The president flew around the country, talking about the benefits of the new health care law.

English Definition: to scold strictly or angrily
Example Sentence: The coach berated the players for their lack of effort during the game.

English Definition: to give as a gift; to confer
Example Sentence: The university bestowed an honorary degree upon the famous author.

English Definition: to brag or talk with excessive pride
Example Sentence: He likes to boast about his expensive car, which annoys his friends.

English Definition: to help raise or increase something
Example Sentence: The advertising campaign was designed to boost sales during the holiday season.

English Definition: rude and tactless; self-assertive in a rude way
Example Sentence: His brash behavior at the meeting offended several of the senior managers.

English Definition: short (in terms of time); not long-lasting
Example Sentence: Before we begin class, let me briefly introduce myself.

English Definition: abrupt to the point of rudeness; curt
Example Sentence: She asked for a refund, but the clerk gave a brusque reply and walked away.

English Definition: a harsh, unpleasant mixture of noise
Example Sentence: The classroom was filled with a cacophony of shouts and laughter as the students played.

English Definition: able to do
Example Sentence: Near the age of twelve months, children are capable of walking.

English Definition: the amount or volume something can hold; ability (especially mental)
Example Sentence: Few birds have the capacity to recognize themselves when looking in a mirror.

English Definition: to stop
Example Sentence: The factory ceased operations after the fire destroyed the machinery.

English Definition: to express strong disapproval
Example Sentence: The senator was censured by the committee for his inappropriate comments.

English Definition: to say something isn't true; something difficult; to suggest a fight or argument
Example Sentence: Einstein's writings challenged many ideas of the time.

English Definition: arranged in order of time or date
Example Sentence: The history textbook lists the events of the war in chronological order.

English Definition: the situation, facts or environment around an event
Example Sentence: My professor only gives extra time to finish essays under special circumstances.

English Definition: to make clear; to remove confusion
Example Sentence: Could you please clarify your last point? I didn't quite understand it.

English Definition: to combine or grow together
Example Sentence: The different groups coalesced into a single powerful movement.

English Definition: to force someone to do something against their will
Example Sentence: The suspect claimed that he was coerced into signing the confession.

English Definition: being aware or having knowledge of something
Example Sentence: She was fully cognizant of the risks involved in the investment.

English Definition: uniting; becoming one
Example Sentence: Team building exercises are designed to improve social cohesion among employees.

English Definition: to occur at the same time
Example Sentence: My birthday coincides with a national holiday this year.

English Definition: to fall down or break down
Example Sentence: The old bridge collapsed under the weight of the heavy truck.

English Definition: to hit one another with a forceful impact
Example Sentence: The two cars collided at the intersection because the traffic light was broken.

English Definition: an observation, note, or response; to say a short response or opinion
Example Sentence: The professor was angry about the negative comments made about his teaching style.

English Definition: to do or perform (negative action); to promise to; to give all energy to
Example Sentence: I'm completely committed to our baseball team's success; I'd do anything to win.

English Definition: a group of people living or working together
Example Sentence: The Spanish-speaking community within New York City includes millions of people.

English Definition: to help correct a problem with another, positive thing
Example Sentence: The pay at Ian's new job was low, but the freedom his boss gave him compensated for that.

English Definition: with many different parts and difficult to understand; complicated
Example Sentence: The science behind the atomic bomb was highly complex at the time.

English Definition: a part of a whole
Example Sentence: Many electronics are made of thousands of smaller components and wires.

English Definition: to hide
Example Sentence: He tried to conceal his disappointment with a fake smile.

English Definition: to focus attention on something; to come together into a smaller space
Example Sentence: You must learn to concentrate to be successful on the test.

English Definition: an abstract idea
Example Sentence: Some concepts within advanced mathematics are hard to show in the real world.

English Definition: to agree
Example Sentence: The board members concurred with the chairman's decision to merge.

English Definition: to organize and manage (for an event that takes careful planning)
Example Sentence: My research team is conducting a study on how the Internet is changing dating.

English Definition: an argument, long battle, or difference of opinions
Example Sentence: The conflict in Syria has forced many people to leave the country.

English Definition: result, effect, what happens because of an event
Example Sentence: If you hurt the people around you, there will be unwanted consequences.

English Definition: large enough or important enough to get special notice
Example Sentence: A considerable number of popular sports were invented in only the last 100 years.

English Definition: to be made of
Example Sentence: The U.S. consists of fifty states.

English Definition: not changing and not stopping; continuous
Example Sentence: The river flows constantly through the year and never freezes.

English Definition: to be the pieces that make a whole
Example Sentence: Fifty states constitute the U.S.A.

English Definition: to limit the activity of; to restrict
Example Sentence: Popular belief says that a pet fish's size is constrained by the size of the tank it's in.

English Definition: to build
Example Sentence: The land flooded every year, so it was unsafe to construct buildings on it.

English Definition: to eat; to use
Example Sentence: No country consumes more oil than the U.S.A.

English Definition: to communicate; communication; touching
Example Sentence: Liam is still in contact with many of his high-school teachers.

English Definition: to consider thoughtfully
Example Sentence: She contemplated moving to a different city for a fresh start.

English Definition: the information or situation around an idea, event, or something that is said
Example Sentence: When you have difficulty understanding a new word, look at the context.

English Definition: to give the opposite opinion
Example Sentence: The witness's statement contradicted the evidence found at the scene.

English Definition: to look specifically at the differences; to be clearly different
Example Sentence: The zebra's black and white stripes contrast clearly with the yellow grass around it.

English Definition: to give something to help reach a goal; to add to the cause
Example Sentence: I smoked a lot when I was younger, and that's contributed to my health problems today.

English Definition: to make known; to transport
Example Sentence: She conveyed her gratitude with a warm smile.

English Definition: to work with or communicate with the different people or pieces involved
Example Sentence: A chef at a big restaurant will spend his time coordinating all the workings of the kitchen.

English Definition: abundant; plentiful
Example Sentence: She took copious notes during the lecture to ensure she didn't miss any details.

English Definition: the center of something; central, of fundamental importance
Example Sentence: Although we have made improvements in brain science, many of the core problems remain.

English Definition: to be a close match; to send letters back and forth
Example Sentence: This new paint for the room does not correspond to the old paint.

English Definition: the measures by which you judge or decide something
Example Sentence: A good TOEFL essay includes a few criteria, including good structure and clear ideas.

English Definition: burdensome; clumsy
Example Sentence: The old machinery was cumbersome and difficult to operate.

English Definition: information, facts
Example Sentence: We collect data on the oceans' temperatures every year.

English Definition: to argue, usually in a formal, polite way
Example Sentence: Watching the presidential debates on TV did not help me decide who to vote for.

English Definition: to decline in health or excellence
Example Sentence: Sugar can cause your teeth to decay if you don't brush them regularly.

English Definition: to trick or mislead
Example Sentence: The magician deceived the audience with his clever hand movements.

English Definition: to find the meaning of; to decode
Example Sentence: It took years for scholars to decipher the ancient hieroglyphics.

English Definition: to politely refuse; to become less/fewer; a slow continuous loss
Example Sentence: I declined dinner because I had plans to eat with my family instead.

English Definition: to come to a conclusion through logic and evidence
Example Sentence: By analyzing the bones, we can deduce when the animal lived.

English Definition: to show an example of, to prove with evidence
Example Sentence: At eight years old, Mozart demonstrated his musical ability in London.

English Definition: to significantly decrease; to use up
Example Sentence: Overfishing has depleted the fish population in this area.

English Definition: to deliver and leave an item
Example Sentence: He went to the bank to deposit his paycheck.

English Definition: to get or create from; to originate from
Example Sentence: Many European languages are derived at least partly from Latin.

English Definition: to locate something
Example Sentence: The smoke alarm detected the fire immediately.

English Definition: to differ from the norm
Example Sentence: The plane had to deviate from its original flight path due to the storm.

English Definition: to plan or create
Example Sentence: They devised a plan to escape from the locked room.

English Definition: a situation where one must choose between two difficult choices
Example Sentence: He faced a dilemma: should he accept the job offer or stay in school?

English Definition: to shrink or reduce
Example Sentence: His influence in the company diminished after the scandal.

English Definition: separate, not the same thing and with no parts in common
Example Sentence: Your left arm and right arm are controlled by two discrete areas of the brain.

English Definition: clearly different from
Example Sentence: There are at least five distinct types of turtle living on the island.

English Definition: to give out something; to give portions of something
Example Sentence: The teacher distributed tests to the class.

English Definition: having many different types
Example Sentence: The student population is incredibly diverse, with students from 30 different countries.

English Definition: constantly changing
Example Sentence: The market is dynamic and changes every day.

English Definition: maximizing productivity
Example Sentence: LED lights are more efficient than traditional light bulbs.

English Definition: to remove
Example Sentence: You can eliminate wrong answers to improve your chance of guessing correctly.

English Definition: moving speech or writing
Example Sentence: The politician gave an eloquent speech that inspired the crowd.

English Definition: to come out of
Example Sentence: After a winter spent sleeping, the bear emerges from its cave.

English Definition: to place extra importance on one part
Example Sentence: Most modern art emphasizes creativity and emotion, not skill.

English Definition: to make something possible
Example Sentence: The classes in college will enable you to find a good job.

English Definition: to suffer through something difficult with patience
Example Sentence: Marathon runners must endure pain and exhaustion to finish the race.

English Definition: to intensify or magnify; to improve
Example Sentence: Adding spices can enhance the flavor of the dish.

English Definition: to make sure or certain
Example Sentence: Please ensure that all doors are locked before leaving.

English Definition: a thing that exists or acts as one unit
Example Sentence: The two companies merged to form a single corporate entity.

English Definition: equal
Example Sentence: His 6.7 GPA in his home country was equivalent to a 3.2 GPA in the United States.

English Definition: to build, to create (of a system, organization, or idea)
Example Sentence: The U.S. government was established in the late 1700s.

English Definition: to determine roughly the value or number of something
Example Sentence: Be careful to not forget any costs for the year when you estimate your budget.

English Definition: to form an idea of the amount, number or value of something; to assess
Example Sentence: Students are evaluated by their grades on tests, homework, and essays.

English Definition: facts or evidence that help prove or disprove something
Example Sentence: The police found no evidence linking him to the crime.

English Definition: to gradually change
Example Sentence: Birds are believed to have evolved from dinosaurs.

English Definition: to not include, to not put in a list or group
Example Sentence: I eat almost anything, excluding spicy foods.

English Definition: to make larger; to give more detail on a subject
Example Sentence: Blowing air into a balloon will cause it to expand.

English Definition: expert knowledge or skill in a particular field
Example Sentence: We hired him for his expertise in computer programming.

English Definition: to use selfishly
Example Sentence: The company was accused of exploiting its workers by paying them very low wages.

English Definition: to show or reveal something that was hidden
Example Sentence: The politician's crimes were exposed and he was forced to leave his position.

English Definition: outside (especially of a body or system)
Example Sentence: Uncontrollable, external events can cause even a very careful company to fail.

English Definition: to make easy or easier
Example Sentence: Classical music will generally facilitate learning and improve memory.

English Definition: a fact that influences or changes a result
Example Sentence: Two of the largest factors affecting children's healthy growth are food and relationships with parents.

English Definition: possible to do
Example Sentence: It is not feasible to finish this project by tomorrow; we need more time.

English Definition: an important characteristic; to include as an important piece
Example Sentence: The sound made by 'r' is one of the most difficult features of spoken English.

English Definition: having an end or limits
Example Sentence: Natural resources like oil and coal are finite.

English Definition: to change continually
Example Sentence: Stock prices fluctuate every day based on market conditions.

English Definition: the center of attention; to look at or think about
Example Sentence: I could not focus on my homework in the library because someone was playing music.

English Definition: a structure for a building, system, or idea
Example Sentence: Ellen's business plan formed the framework for her next successful plan.

English Definition: what something does; to work
Example Sentence: I dropped my phone into a swimming pool, but amazingly, it still functions.

English Definition: basic, central; extremely important
Example Sentence: The fundamental beliefs of most religions are peaceful.

English Definition: a space in between two objects; a difference
Example Sentence: The gap between the rich and the poor has widened over the last decade.

English Definition: communication that is distorted and unclear
Example Sentence: The radio transmission was garbled, so we couldn't understand the pilot's message.

English Definition: to create, to produce (especially energy)
Example Sentence: Movement generates heat.

English Definition: to agree to give (something asked for); to admit something is true
Example Sentence: The government has recently granted us access to information that was secret before.

English Definition: pompous; overly important
Example Sentence: He had grandiose plans to build a castle, but he couldn't afford it.

English Definition: overused and unoriginal
Example Sentence: The plot of the movie was hackneyed and predictable from the start.

English Definition: lacking planning
Example Sentence: The books were piled in a haphazard way, making it impossible to find anything.

English Definition: not gentle; unpleasant
Example Sentence: The harsh winter weather killed many of the plants in the garden.

English Definition: in a hurry; acting too quickly
Example Sentence: He made a hasty decision to quit his job and later regretted it.

English Definition: full of risk; dangerous
Example Sentence: Working with toxic chemicals can be hazardous to your health.

English Definition: therefore, so, as a result
Example Sentence: The evidence is false; hence, the conclusion is also false.

English Definition: to pause, often due to reluctance
Example Sentence: She hesitated before answering the difficult question.

English Definition: a ranking system
Example Sentence: There is a strict hierarchy in the military that must be followed.

English Definition: something that causes delay or resistance
Example Sentence: Heavy traffic is a major hindrance to getting to work on time.

English Definition: empty inside
Example Sentence: The old tree was hollow inside, providing a home for owls.

English Definition: extremely unfriendly
Example Sentence: The audience was hostile towards the speaker, booing him as he walked on stage.

English Definition: an idea which explains something but is unproven
Example Sentence: The hypothesis that the Earth is growing was shown to be false.

English Definition: exactly the same
Example Sentence: The twins look identical, so it is hard to tell them apart.

English Definition: to name, to show or figure out what something is
Example Sentence: Scientists have not been able to identify the language written on the rocks.

English Definition: unable to read
Example Sentence: Programs were set up to help illiterate adults learn to read and write.

English Definition: to explain with an example
Example Sentence: Peter illustrated his point by telling a short story.

English Definition: an effect that changes a situation; to affect strongly
Example Sentence: The end of the war had a large impact on economic growth.

English Definition: to worsen; to damage
Example Sentence: Lack of sleep can impair your ability to drive safely.

English Definition: to carry out; to put into effect
Example Sentence: The school implemented a new dress code policy starting this semester.

English Definition: to communicate without saying specifically; to hint at an idea
Example Sentence: The president implied that he would not support the new law, but he didn't say it clearly.

English Definition: to force upon
Example Sentence: The government imposed a new tax on imported goods.

English Definition: a reason to do something; motivation
Example Sentence: Bonus money is a good incentive for employees to work harder.

English Definition: continuing without pause
Example Sentence: The incessant noise from the construction site made it hard to concentrate.

English Definition: a minor part; occurring by chance
Example Sentence: Any travel expenses are incidental to the main cost of the project.

English Definition: to urge on; to encourage (usually negative behavior)
Example Sentence: The speech incited the crowd to protest in the streets.

English Definition: a preference; a tendency
Example Sentence: My natural inclination is to sleep late on weekends.

English Definition: incapable; lacking ability
Example Sentence: He was fired for being incompetent and unable to complete his tasks.

English Definition: changing randomly; not staying the same
Example Sentence: His grades are inconsistent; sometimes he gets A's, and other times he fails.

English Definition: to be a sign of, to show
Example Sentence: The way you speak and act indicates your emotions.

English Definition: not able to be challenged; undeniable
Example Sentence: It is an indisputable fact that the earth revolves around the sun.

English Definition: single or separated; only one of
Example Sentence: Joan was surprised that the ten books she ordered came in individual boxes.

English Definition: unable to be avoided
Example Sentence: It was inevitable that they would eventually find out the truth.

English Definition: to guess based on evidence
Example Sentence: I inferred from her silence that she was angry.

English Definition: the ability to have an impact on something
Example Sentence: Parents have a strong influence on their children's behavior.

English Definition: at the beginning
Example Sentence: My initial plan was to study until midnight and wake up late.

English Definition: an investigation to determine the truth
Example Sentence: The police launched an inquiry into the cause of the accident.

English Definition: an example, a case
Example Sentence: Two animals in Australia are the only instances of mammals that lay eggs.

English Definition: to start (a rule or system); a group or organization
Example Sentence: The National Cancer Institute was created to learn more about cancer.

English Definition: necessary to complete the whole
Example Sentence: Trust is integral to a good relationship.

English Definition: to become a part of; to combine
Example Sentence: It is difficult to smoothly integrate a foreign culture into the main culture of a country.

English Definition: to figure out or explain the meaning of something
Example Sentence: The students could not interpret the extremely old book because the pages were hard to read.

English Definition: to come between people, objects, or an event and change what is happening
Example Sentence: The teacher intervened to stop the fight between the students.

English Definition: fearless; adventurous
Example Sentence: The intrepid explorer traveled to the South Pole alone.

English Definition: highly detailed
Example Sentence: The pattern on the rug was very intricate and beautiful.

English Definition: to spend money, energy, or time hoping for good results
Example Sentence: Jamie invested in an education company that he thought would succeed.

English Definition: to try to find answers to questions about something, to research
Example Sentence: Doctors are investigating a newly discovered plant that might help to fight cancer.

English Definition: to include, to have as a part
Example Sentence: The study of architecture involves both art and science.

English Definition: easy to anger
Example Sentence: The irascible old man yelled at the kids for playing on his lawn.

English Definition: the use of words to give a meaning opposite to their literal meaning; a paradoxical situation
Example Sentence: The irony is that he stole a car to get to the police station faster.

English Definition: a topic or situation to talk about; a problem
Example Sentence: In order to define what jazz music is, we need to look at a few different issues.

English Definition: words specific to a certain job or group
Example Sentence: The contract was full of legal jargon that I couldn't understand.

English Definition: together
Example Sentence: The project was funded jointly by the government and private investors.

English Definition: to give a good reason for an action or situation
Example Sentence: Milos could not justify borrowing his brother's car without asking.

English Definition: a special talent or skill
Example Sentence: He has a knack for fixing computers without looking at the manual.

English Definition: a name or phrase given to a group; to identify
Example Sentence: Children are often unkind and label others who look different as outsiders.

English Definition: work; effort
Example Sentence: Juan was surprised at how much labor was needed to finish his project on time.

English Definition: to fall behind
Example Sentence: The runner injured his leg and began to lag behind the others.

English Definition: something that covers something else; to put something on top
Example Sentence: Layers of paint on the steel bridge will protect it from rust.

English Definition: a long speech about one topic (especially in a classroom)
Example Sentence: Professor Jackson's lectures are too long; I always fall asleep.

English Definition: lawful; reasonable
Example Sentence: He has a legitimate claim to the property since he bought it legally.

English Definition: merciful; less harsh
Example Sentence: The teacher was lenient with the student who turned in the homework one day late.

English Definition: to create a connection; a connection between two things
Example Sentence: The news story linked the president's success with the improved economy.

English Definition: to keep in good condition; to continue to say although people disagree
Example Sentence: Christopher Columbus maintained that he had sailed to Asia, not America.

English Definition: very important, or large in size
Example Sentence: The exam score is a major part of the final class grade.

English Definition: to influence, especially in an unfair way
Example Sentence: He was accused of trying to manipulate the stock price.

English Definition: to make as big as possible; to use or do as completely as possible
Example Sentence: In order to maximize the number of people that can fit on the plane, the airline took out the restrooms.

English Definition: to find the size and dimensions of something
Example Sentence: He measured the room to see if the sofa would fit.

English Definition: ordinary, average; not very good
Example Sentence: The food at the restaurant was mediocre, not great but not terrible.

English Definition: to fix
Example Sentence: She mended the hole in her shirt with a needle and thread.

English Definition: of the mind
Example Sentence: Many mental problems are still not well understood.

English Definition: how to do something, a process
Example Sentence: The Spanish method of making chocolate created a completely new drink.

English Definition: to move from one place to another
Example Sentence: Birds migrate south for the winter to find warmer weather.

English Definition: to make small changes or add to in order to make better
Example Sentence: The first bicycles were slow and difficult to use, but they were modified over time.

English Definition: to watch the quality or progress of something over time
Example Sentence: We have been carefully monitoring the amount of salt in our oceans for the last 50 years.

English Definition: to make not true or not effective
Example Sentence: Studying late into the night might help you learn more, but sleeping less negates the positive effects.

English Definition: a system of connected pieces
Example Sentence: The typhoon destroyed the network of roads, which has made it hard to bring supplies.

English Definition: however, regardless
Example Sentence: The decision was dangerous. Nevertheless, Hitler attacked Russia.

English Definition: a belief; an idea
Example Sentence: I think the professor's notion of fun was different from the students' notion of fun.

English Definition: a goal; based in fact, not an opinion
Example Sentence: The objective of the TOEFL is to measure your total English ability.

English Definition: to get or secure something
Example Sentence: After lots of looking, Jorge obtained a job and apartment in New York City.

English Definition: easily understood or seen
Example Sentence: The results of the election were so clear that the loser admitted defeat immediately.

English Definition: to be in or on a space, to fill a space
Example Sentence: The dentist's office occupied the entire fourth floor of the building.

English Definition: to happen
Example Sentence: The sinking of the Titanic occurred on April 14, 1912.

English Definition: to unfairly burden; to keep down by force
Example Sentence: The dictator oppressed the people for years, denying them basic rights.

English Definition: to move into a position; to explore and become comfortable with
Example Sentence: It took a few weeks to orient myself in the new job, but I feel comfortable now.

English Definition: in general, for the most part; looking at all pieces
Example Sentence: Overall, Americans eat a lot of beef compared to people in other countries.

English Definition: to join or take part in
Example Sentence: The teacher was surprised when every student participated in the math game.

English Definition: to be aware of, to sense or feel
Example Sentence: If hunters are skilled, the animals will not perceive their presence.

English Definition: a range or amount of time
Example Sentence: Computer technology changed a lot in the period between the 1980s and the year 2000.

English Definition: to continue, especially when facing opposition
Example Sentence: If your symptoms persist, you should see a doctor immediately.

English Definition: a point of view or opinion; how you see something
Example Sentence: Many Hollywood movies, when watched from a woman's perspective, have clearly sexist characters.

English Definition: a period of time in a longer process of change
Example Sentence: There are at least three different phases in a frog's development from egg to adult.

English Definition: the study of knowledge; a basic idea that affects actions
Example Sentence: My philosophy is that if you can do something today, you shouldn't wait until tomorrow.

English Definition: of the body (not mental); concrete
Example Sentence: Cleaning up the campus garden was tiring, physical work.

English Definition: a rule made by an organization, government, or company
Example Sentence: School policy does not allow alcohol on campus.

English Definition: possible ability that might be used in the future
Example Sentence: Wind and solar energy have the potential to replace oil.

English Definition: exact; carefully defined
Example Sentence: Because the pirates weren't certain of the precise location of the gold, they dug holes all over.

English Definition: to say something will happen in the future
Example Sentence: Charlie Chaplin predicted that movies would never become popular. He was wrong.

English Definition: widespread; common
Example Sentence: Flu is prevalent in the winter, so it's important to wash your hands often.

English Definition: happening before the one happening now
Example Sentence: Soojin thought her science class was really hard after studying only literature in the previous year.

English Definition: first in importance; first in time
Example Sentence: The primary cause of unhappiness is not about money--it is bad health.

English Definition: a rule or idea that makes the base for a system
Example Sentence: The principles at the heart of the new religion are the same as many central beliefs of Christianity.

English Definition: happening or being before
Example Sentence: The new CEO of Yahoo called the prior CEO of the company to get a better understanding.

English Definition: to begin or continue with some action
Example Sentence: We will not proceed with the construction until someone tells us it is safe.

English Definition: a plan or task; to predict; to send out
Example Sentence: Based on this year's success, Apple is projecting similar growth next year.

English Definition: to further the progress of something; to encourage
Example Sentence: The organization works to promote healthy eating habits among children.

English Definition: the size or amount of something compared to the whole
Example Sentence: Cartoons of people often have exaggerated proportions, such as very large eyes.

English Definition: to try to achieve (a dream or goal); to follow
Example Sentence: Man pursued the dream of flight for hundreds of years before the modern airplane was invented.

English Definition: a disagreement or fight; to have an argument
Example Sentence: The neighbors had a quarrel over the loud music playing late at night.

English Definition: the distance between two things; to be between a set minimum and maximum
Example Sentence: In the company, the age of people ranges from 25 to 75.

English Definition: an official position or station
Example Sentence: He rose to the rank of captain in just three years.

English Definition: to respond, act in answer to
Example Sentence: Mothers react quickly to their babies' cries, even in the middle of the night.

English Definition: to sternly disapprove or reprimand
Example Sentence: The mother rebuked her child for running into the street.

English Definition: to give a brief summary
Example Sentence: At the end of the lecture, the professor recapitulated the main points.

English Definition: to retreat; to move back
Example Sentence: The floodwaters began to recede after the rain stopped.

English Definition: to present someone with confidence and approval
Example Sentence: I recommend the pasta; it is delicious.

English Definition: to make changes that improve something
Example Sentence: The government plans to reform the healthcare system.

English Definition: an area of land
Example Sentence: Although most Japanese students come from Osaka, Akiko comes from the northern region.

English Definition: to put your name in a list; to identify and show on a tool for measuring
Example Sentence: The bomb was so strong that far away weather balloons registered the heat.

English Definition: to control a process so that it functions correctly
Example Sentence: Parents regulate the amount of time kids spend playing games on their phones.

English Definition: to strengthen with added support
Example Sentence: They used steel beams to reinforce the building's structure.

English Definition: to say no to something that is offered
Example Sentence: After applying to ten schools, Lucas was rejected by nine of them.

English Definition: to free; to allow to be known
Example Sentence: The company released a new version of the software yesterday.

English Definition: closely connected to the topic and therefore important
Example Sentence: I think Professor McGarry can give you some relevant books to help you write that essay.

English Definition: to depend on
Example Sentence: In many countries, children rely on their parents for financial support until their 20s.

English Definition: to take away or take out
Example Sentence: The grocery store removed all of the milk after the government said it was unsafe.

English Definition: to express disapproval or disappointment
Example Sentence: She reproached him for forgetting their anniversary.

English Definition: to need for a specific purpose
Example Sentence: All life, plants and animals included, requires water.

English Definition: to find information about something; information collected about something
Example Sentence: Dr. Stanislaus was famous for his research on changes in health education.

English Definition: to feel bitterness or anger towards someone or something
Example Sentence: She resented being treated like a child by her older siblings.

English Definition: to live in a place
Example Sentence: I reside in California.

English Definition: to give up an office or position
Example Sentence: The CEO resigned after the scandal was made public.

English Definition: to withstand the effect of
Example Sentence: It is hard to resist the temptation of chocolate cake.

English Definition: to solve a problem; to come to a firm decision
Example Sentence: Even after meeting for hours, the leaders could not resolve their argument.

English Definition: some saved material that can be used for a purpose (money, oil, etc.)
Example Sentence: Many of the richest countries have surprisingly few natural resources.

English Definition: answer; react
Example Sentence: If you scare a turtle, it will respond by hiding in its shell.

English Definition: to limit, to make some actions impossible
Example Sentence: Access to this parking area is restricted to university students.

English Definition: to keep, continue to have or contain
Example Sentence: Originally from France, Jean retains a hint of her French accent even today.

English Definition: to withdraw something after it's found to be untrue; to draw back in
Example Sentence: The newspaper retracted the story after discovering the source was lying.

English Definition: to bring back
Example Sentence: The dog ran to retrieve the ball.

English Definition: used just for style or impact (often not needing an answer)
Example Sentence: He asked a rhetorical question to make the audience think, not to get an answer.

English Definition: stiff, unyielding
Example Sentence: The school has rigid rules about student conduct.

English Definition: a job or function; a position
Example Sentence: Student class president is an important role.

English Definition: to turn
Example Sentence: The earth rotates on its axis once every 24 hours.

English Definition: something that serves as protection; to protect
Example Sentence: Wearing a helmet is a safeguard against head injuries.

English Definition: a large plan; the system by which something is arranged
Example Sentence: Microsoft's marketing scheme for their new tablet was less than successful.

English Definition: to very carefully examine
Example Sentence: The detective scrutinized the crime scene for clues.

English Definition: a part of the whole
Example Sentence: Every ant's body has three sections: a head, a thorax, and an abdomen.

English Definition: to attach something so that is won't come off
Example Sentence: Please tightly secure the surfboards on top of the car.

English Definition: to look for, to try to find
Example Sentence: Across many cultures, heroes seek more than just gold or fame.

English Definition: to choose; chosen as the best from a group
Example Sentence: Harvard students are a select group of very intelligent students.

English Definition: things that follow each other in a certain order
Example Sentence: The numbers must be entered in the correct sequence to open the lock.

English Definition: harsh or strict; grave
Example Sentence: The storm caused severe damage to the coastal towns.

English Definition: not deep
Example Sentence: The river is shallow here, so we can walk across it.

English Definition: to protect from something harmful
Example Sentence: The cave sheltered the hikers from the rain.

English Definition: to move something a short distance; a small change
Example Sentence: Please help me shift the table so it is easier for people to sit down.

English Definition: to become smaller
Example Sentence: My sweater shrank after I washed it in hot water.

English Definition: important or big enough that you should notice
Example Sentence: Most animals spend a significant amount of their time looking for food.

English Definition: the location of something
Example Sentence: The people voted for a site downtown as the location of the new stadium.

English Definition: alone; without others
Example Sentence: Tigers are solitary animals that prefer to live alone.

English Definition: gloomy; depressing
Example Sentence: The funeral was a somber occasion.

English Definition: to calm or comfort
Example Sentence: She sang a lullaby to soothe the crying baby.

English Definition: where something comes from
Example Sentence: Do not trust books that give information without listed sources.

English Definition: thinly scattered
Example Sentence: Vegetation is sparse in the desert due to lack of water.

English Definition: to say which one or clearly point to which one
Example Sentence: The king did not specify which daughter the hero could marry.

English Definition: to form a theory without strong evidence
Example Sentence: We can only speculate about why he left the company so suddenly.

English Definition: filthy and unpleasant
Example Sentence: The refugees were living in squalid conditions.

English Definition: not likely to change, fall, or move
Example Sentence: Make sure the ladder is stable before you climb up it.

English Definition: sluggish; showing little movement
Example Sentence: The economy has been stagnant for the past few years.

English Definition: the rank or social class; the current situation
Example Sentence: The status of women has slowly improved over the past 100 years.

English Definition: a plan to reach a desired outcome
Example Sentence: The debate team discussed their strategy for defeating the other team.

English Definition: to place extra importance on; pressure, strain
Example Sentence: If you stress the wrong words when speaking English, you may not be understood.

English Definition: coming after something in time
Example Sentence: The winter and the subsequent spring were surprisingly dry.

English Definition: to take out and put something else in; something that goes in the place of
Example Sentence: Many smokers who try to quit use chewing gum as a substitute.

English Definition: difficult to notice right away
Example Sentence: There was a subtle change in his attitude after the meeting.

English Definition: enough to serve a particular purpose
Example Sentence: Because of weather changes, last year farms couldn't grow sufficient rice.

English Definition: to briefly give the main points
Example Sentence: Can you summarize the plot of the movie in one sentence?

English Definition: to oversee work or a process
Example Sentence: The manager supervises a team of twenty employees.

English Definition: to take the place of something else
Example Sentence: E-books are slowly supplanting physical books.

English Definition: to hang something; to temporarily stop
Example Sentence: Construction on the bridge was suspended due to the storm.

English Definition: having the belief that someone is doing something dishonest
Example Sentence: His behavior was suspicious, so the police decided to investigate.

English Definition: to keep going; to help something continue
Example Sentence: No animals or plants can sustain life without water.

English Definition: serving as a symbol
Example Sentence: The dove is symbolic of peace.

English Definition: relating to a specific subject or craft
Example Sentence: The manual is full of technical terms that I don't understand.

English Definition: situated at the end
Example Sentence: He was diagnosed with a terminal illness.

English Definition: an idea or belief about how/why something works
Example Sentence: There are many theories about why we dream.

English Definition: to put up with
Example Sentence: I cannot tolerate this noise any longer.

English Definition: a set of beliefs passed from family to family
Example Sentence: Chris's favorite tradition is eating ham on Christmas.

English Definition: to move from one place to another
Example Sentence: Sally transferred all of her money from the bank when she heard they were closing.

English Definition: to change from one state or condition to another
Example Sentence: The company is transitioning to a new computer system.

English Definition: easy to see through; easy to detect
Example Sentence: The glass is transparent, so you can see what is inside.

English Definition: the direction or way in which something is changing
Example Sentence: Today's computer culture is trending toward more touch-screen technology.

English Definition: the fee for instruction at a school
Example Sentence: College tuition has increased significantly in recent years.

English Definition: forming the basis for something
Example Sentence: There is no single way to end drug addiction since there are many underlying causes.

English Definition: not attracting attention
Example Sentence: She tried to be unobtrusive as she slipped into the back of the room.

English Definition: unharmed
Example Sentence: Miraculously, he walked away from the car accident unscathed.

English Definition: happy, optimistic
Example Sentence: Despite the bad news, she remained upbeat.

English Definition: unfair
Example Sentence: The punishment was unjust because he didn't do anything wrong.

English Definition: to waver or be indecisive
Example Sentence: He vacillated between ordering pizza and making a sandwich.

English Definition: from a reasonable or correct basis; just
Example Sentence: Many people have said Pollock's work didn't require much skill, and that idea is somewhat valid.

English Definition: to disappear quickly
Example Sentence: The magician made the rabbit vanish from the hat.

English Definition: to be a different size, amount, or character
Example Sentence: The restaurants in this area vary greatly in quantity and price.

English Definition: a judgement or decision
Example Sentence: The jury delivered a verdict of not guilty.

English Definition: a small trace of something that is disappearing
Example Sentence: These old ruins are the last vestige of a once-great civilization.

English Definition: a small container used to hold liquids
Example Sentence: The scientist carefully opened the vial containing the chemical.

English Definition: to speak poorly of; to slander
Example Sentence: The politician was vilified by the press for his mistake.

English Definition: taking up a lot of space
Example Sentence: She wore a voluminous dress that filled the entire hallway.

English Definition: how healthy and happy a person or group is
Example Sentence: A perfect government would care more about the welfare of its people than anything else.

English Definition: although (used to contrast two different things)
Example Sentence: Lemons are very sour whereas most fruits are sweet.

English Definition: completely
Example Sentence: I am wholly committed to this project.

English Definition: occurring over a large region
Example Sentence: There was widespread panic when the earthquake hit.

English Definition: to droop and become limp
Example Sentence: The flowers began to wilt because I forgot to water them.
